page.title: 18HOME LIFE
page.content: On Saturday at 7.40 I woke to the birds calling. On listening more care- fully I could also hear the busy A604. At 8.00 I made my bed, dressed and went down for my breakfast (bacon, fried potatoes, brown bread & a cup of tea). At 9.l5 I washed. In summer our water is heated by electricity but in winter this is supplied by our fire. I cleaned my teeth and helped clear the breakfast away. At 10.10 we went shop- ping. We have the smallest car in Britain, a Fiat 126. We went to the Grafton Centre, the City Centre,Sains- bury's, then home and I played with my remote controlled car. Later we went to the local fair. At 5.00 I went home and played a board game. Then we had tea (chicken nuggets, chips and home made eclairs). In the evening we walked round Wandlebury Ring (on the Gog Magog hills) and had a barbecue.
